div.div: April 20, 2020 Dear Parents and Guardians, Well, the time has come that Governor Pritzker has closed schools for the remainder of the school year. Remote Learning Days will continue through the end of the school year. Parents and students have continued to ask, “Do we have to do...
Click on Parent Letter 4-15-20 to download the letter.

Remote Learning Days Kansas Unit School District #3 Description: For any school or district that does not implement an e-learning program under Section 10-20.56 of the Code, the school or district must adopt a Remote Learning Day Plan approved by the school’s or district’s superintendent or chief administrator. Each school...

March 30, 2020 Dear Parents/Guardians, Hello! I hope everyone is doing well during this time of social distancing. I wanted to proceed with information on the plan for continued remote learning. Posted on our website are the requirements that we will begin to follow starting March 31...
Here are some resources that you can download and use while the school is closed.

h2.a: Open Letter from our Superintendent -Coronavirus and School Closure

div.div: March 16, 2020 Dear Parents/Guardians, As you know, the Governor has closed schools for the next two weeks over concerns about the Coronavirus. We are in uncharted waters. Yet, we are not adrift, but have a plan to move forward. Kansas Schools will be closed to students from...

Oakland CUSD#5, as part of the Tri-County Co-op, is looking for an individual to fill the role of head coach for high school golf. Interested individuals should email Amanda Coffey, principal, to express interest in the position. Emails should be sent to amanda.coffey@oakland5.org. The deadline to apply for this position...
Sign up today for the Tri-County Summer co-op Baseball/ Softball program. Download this form, fill it out, turn it in and have fun this summer!
This is from Beaver Works Summer Institute. It is a 4 week program at MIT. It challenges high school students to tackle high-tech projects.
If your child is going to be absent and you cannot call in you may send a email to absence@kansas.k12.il.us and let us know. Thank you!
May 20 @ 6:00 pm

The regularly scheduled board meeting is 6:00 p.m. on the third Wednesday of each month at the Superintendent’s Office, 310 S. Front Street, Kansas, however, dates may deviate from this or be changed from the above at the discretion of the Board with due public notice.

blockquote.p: The mission of Kansas CUSD #3 is to prepare students for life and the challenges they will face after graduation, whether in college or the workforce. We strive to give our students an education that exceeds the standards set by the state through an aligned curriculum and high expectations. Furthermore, we teach our students to be responsible citizens able to handle social and emotional situations in a self-sufficient, productive, and positive manner.
